channel.title: How do you make money?
channel.description:
So, how do you people make money?
I am so broke its not funny. start a new job on friday. which takes up 4 of my weekdays and my saturday. So... its going to eat my soul.
I really need a new source of income that doesnt take 25 hours a day out of my life.
I wanna know how you guys make enough money to survive.

item.title: How do you make money?
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Scam old people.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you make money?
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

Just go to honest work. It’s the most easiest and safest way. And earlier you go to work, the earlier you will get used it. 40 hours of work every week and I earn about 650€. It’s gonna get little higher after a trial period.

I really wouldn’t recommend selling drugs, because there are high risks and you might fuck up your life. Ofcourse it depends where you live and how hot stuff you are selling.

I also wouldn’t advise you to ask money from parents, because at some point they won’t be there for you and you are on your own. So get used it asap. World is a tough place.
“But I got school, I can’t go to work!” - Yes you can, if want. You can’t have everything but you just have to decide what do you want most:
Much money - Less free time
or
Much free time - Less money

It’s really hard to have both

Read full topic

item.title: How do you make money?
item.dc:creator: @Phate Phate
item.description:
@Phate wrote:

I work 40 hours a week selling nuts and bolts from a computer.

Seriously.

Is the NOK some kind of Norweigan money?

Yes Norwegian Krone.
[/quote]
Trade it for some JPY or KRW or CHF?[/quote]
I should trade it USD in September or October, then I had 40% more money now.

Nice way to earn money, but some money and hope the value of them rise.

item.title: How do you make money?

item.description:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:42, topic:245096”][quote author=maniown link=topic=321505.msg2550700#msg2550700 date=1227494721]
This happened just last week. A bowling ally in town went bankrupt. I bought The neon lights and sold them to my friends.
[/quote]
I needed a neon sign, so I could use the transformer to build a tesla coil!
Perhaps I’ll have to put my local bowling alley out of business…[/quote]

  1. Hide in the bathroom of the bowling ally until early morning
  2. Come out and get the neon lights.
  3. Free neon lights?

Just yesterday I was hired at a restaurant as a dishwasher (;D) and that should make me a few hundred bucks at least before the holidays for gifts and such. I make $10 an hour, so that’s pretty good money.
[/quote]
Yes but these are candian dollars which are worth like, 5c USD!![/quote]

This would only mean that you americans make 5c USD/hour.

item.title: How do you make money?
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

If a company goes bankrupt, the stuff they own gets auctioned. Usually everything’s a bargain there, and you can profit from it. You’ll need money to start with, but you’ll earn it back later on.

This happened just last week. A bowling ally in town went bankrupt. I bought The neon lights and sold them to my friends.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you make money?
item.dc:creator: @haticks haticks
item.description:
@haticks wrote:

I make $9 an hour pressure washing houses/driveways/whatever. Im cheap, yes.

I made a good deal of money a while back. They were building a new neighborhood next to mine, so i offerd to cut the grass for all the un sold houses for $15 a yard. They agreed too it. So i payed about 5 friend of mine $10 a yard that they cut for about a month. Ended up making like $600 doing absolutely nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you make money?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:23, topic:245096”][quote author=Niall link=topic=321505.msg2543855#msg2543855 date=1227144804]

I get benefits from the government. Get £30 a week for going to all my lessons at college

Funnily enough, the contract with the company that was suppose to pay that has ended, and some people still haven’t been paid.
[/quote]
What do you mean? I realise the head of the person who controls EMA quit, and a lot of peoples EMA were, and still are delayed. But haven’t heard of a contract ending.[/quote]
I think the company that the government contracted out to managed it all has stopped doing it so either they renew their contract or find someone else to do it.

Read full topic
